content.question: In which of the following ways did public attitudes toward the Civil Rights movement change as a result of sentiments such as those expressed in the excerpt?

choices.label: White approval declined as a result of the perception that aggressive policies like those of the Black Panthers resulted in urban unrest.
Liberal feminists adopted the tactics of the Black Panthers in order to increase the influence of their movement.
Young people increasingly rejected the platform of the Black Panthers in favor of nonviolent tactics.
The federal government responded by enacting social welfare programs favored by the Black Panthers.

content.answer: White approval declined as a result of the perception that aggressive policies like those of the Black Panthers resulted in urban unrest.

topic.text: 8.10: The African American Civil Rights Movement (1960s)

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
